title: "save modified-subds" doesn't save
body:
```
/tmp > rm -rf topds                                                                                                                                                  

/tmp > datalad create /tmp/topds; cd /tmp/topds/; datalad create -d . subds; touch subds/123; datalad -C subds save -m 123 123; git status; 
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/topds                                                                                           
create(ok): /tmp/topds (dataset)                                                                                                                                                                                                  
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/topds/subds 
create(ok): subds (dataset)                                                                                                                                                                                                       
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  create (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
add(ok): 123 (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
On branch master
Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)

	modified:   subds (new commits)

no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")

/tmp/topds > datalad save -m subds subds

/tmp/topds > git status                                                                                                                          
On branch master
Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)

	modified:   subds (new commits)

no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")

/tmp/topds > datalad --version
datalad 0.12.0rc4.dev239
```

expected behavior: updated state of subds is committed within topds.

`subds` does get committed properly if I just run `datalad save` without any path (`subds`) but that wouldn't work for me since dataset is dirty since I have other subdirectories with subdatasets to be created/saved one at a time (see #3233)
